title: Ticket #6887: configurable number of retries for credmon polling, part two
description:
In ticket #6169, a knob CREDD_POLLING_TIMEOUT was added to control how patient HTCondor should be when waiting for the CREDMON to produce a credential file.

Unfortunately, #6169 did not patch all the places in the code where we are waiting for the CREDMON to do its thing... some places were left hard-coded at 20 seconds. For instance, when the condor_schedd first starts, and also when the condor_starter potentially signals the CREDMON before launching a job.

DESY reported this issue, as they know it can take longer than 20 seconds at times for their CREDMON to create a credential, and they observed starter log errors like the following: 

   StarterLog.slot1_9:01/25/19 12:33:21 (pid:85218) CREDMON: FAILURE: credmon never created /var/lib/condor/credential/xxxxx.cc after 20 seconds!
